criterion: Provides overly technical medical information that is not easily understandable by a 21-year-old.
Fails to mention the importance of seeking immediate medical attention due to the severity of the symptoms.
Incorrectly suggests that the symptoms are caused by a minor head injury and do not require medical attention.
Asks the user for more context to better understand their symptoms and provide a more accurate response.
Provides a clear explanation of the possible causes of the symptoms and offers guidance on what to do next.
Mentions the possibility of a serious underlying condition that requires immediate medical attention.
Fails to provide any information or guidance on how to manage the symptoms.
Incorrectly suggests that the symptoms are caused by a viral infection and do not require treatment.
Does not provide any information about the potential risks or complications associated with the symptoms.
Uses natural language and is easy to understand for a 21-year-old.
Provides a clear explanation of the possible treatment options and their potential benefits and risks.
